gmd:metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19139 Geographic Information - Metadata - Implementation Specification

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: Dataset includes all Indiana river reaches on the Nationwide Rivers Inventory (NRI) listed by the U.S. National Park Service (NPS). The file was created using 1:100,000 scale data from the National Hydrography Dataset (NHD), therefore, the lines remain in the NHD reaches, resulting in multiple line segments for each NRI listing. The line segments have NOT been dissolved. The start and end point of each listing segment is approximate and located by described landmarks. The following excerpt from the NPS, NRI website describes the eligibility for a river to be listed- In order to be listed on the NRI, a river must be free-flowing and possess one or more Outstandingly Remarkable Values (ORVs). Thus, the eligibility analysis consists of an examination of the river's hydrology, including any man-made alterations, and an inventory of its natural, cultural, and recreational resources. There are a variety of methods to determine whether certain resources are so unique, rare or exemplary as to make them outstandingly remarkable. The determination that a river area contains ORVs is a professional judgment on the part of the interdisciplinary study team (IDT), based on objective, scientific analysis. Input from organizations and individuals familiar with specific river resources should be sought and documented as part of the process. In order to be assessed as outstandingly remarkable, a river-related value must be a unique, rare, or exemplary feature that is significant at a comparative regional or national scale. Dictionary definitions of the words unique and rare indicate that such a value would be one that is conspicuous example from among a number of similar values that are themselves uncommon or extraordinary. Only one such value is needed for eligibility.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: These data were developed to provide the Indiana subset of the Nationwide Rivers Inventory as a GIS layer.

gmd:credit.gco:CharacterString: U.S. National Park Service, Nationwide Rivers Inventory

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: The start and end point of each water segment is approximate and located by described landmarks. This product is distributed "AS-IS" without warranties of any kind, either expressed or implied, including but not limited to warranties of suitability of a particular purpose or use. No attempt has been made in either the designed format or production of these data to define the limits or jurisdiction of any federal, state, or local government. These data are intended for use only at the published scale or smaller and are for reference purposes only. They are not to be construed as a legal document or survey instrument. A detailed on-the-ground survey and historical analysis of a single site may differ from this data.

No claims to accuracy are made on this data. It is intended to be used only for general planning purposes. Detailed planning or analysis will require more accurate data. gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: This file is available to anyone, but access may be contingent on written request, specific terms relevant to the agency or person making the request, and (or) current freedom of information statutes in the state of Indiana.

gmd:environmentDescription.gco:CharacterString: ESRI ArcGIS 9.2 shapefile format, approximately 765 Kb

gmd:supplementalInformation.gco:CharacterString: Digital data creation done by BLA is fully disclosed in the process steps of this metadata; credit for the information is retained by the U.S. National Park Service (NPS).

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: Data are consistent with the 1:100,000 National Hydrography Dataset (NHD). There are no known overlaps or line gaps. Each line segment ends at intersections. Lines remain in the individual reaches consistent with the NHD and have not been dissolved to reflect singular NRI listings.
All Stream segments in the NPS List of Nationwide Rivers Inventory (NRI) and are included. Stream segments begin and end as closely to the described limits as the data compiler could determine.

Accuracy is determined by the source website listing the classifications, outstanding river values (ORVs), and descriptions of each NRI river. Two exceptions include: (1) Two records for the Little Blue River which appear to encompass the same stretches of river. The attributes of these two records were combined and represented here as a single record. (2) One record of the Wabash River does not have any outstanding values recorded in the original data. This is a known error because all listed rivers must have at least one ORV. It is suspected by the comments to be outstanding for fishing, recreation, and history, but in order to be true to the source, assumptions are not made and the fields are left blank.
Horizontal position is dependent on the accuracy of the national hydrography dataset (1:100,000).

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: National Hydrography Dataset (NHD) was copied for use as the base line file. The Nationwide Rivers Inventory for Indiana segments was used to identify all listed river/stream segments. New attribute fields were added to provide classification categories, outstanding river values (ORVs) and descriptions.

gmd:alternateTitle.gco:CharacterString: Indiana subset of NRI Web site, HYDROGRAPHY_LINE_NHD_IN.SHP

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Initial work described in the previous process step was reviewed and sources were checked for currentness. No updates were identified

This metadata was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (United States Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: HYDROGRAPHY_LINE_NHD_IN: Streams, Rivers, Canals, and Ditches in Indiana (United States Geological Survey, 1:100000, Polygon Shapefile)

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: U.S. Geological Survey and U.S. Environmental Protection Agency

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: Data are from the 2002 NHD data set downloadable from, http://nhd.usgs.gov/index.html

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: All base information to identify river segments and complete attributes.

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the BLA. It should not to be altered or summarized. BLA does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the BLA, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.

gmd:maintenanceNote.gco:CharacterString: Metadata was created as or translated to ISO 19139 for inclusion in the Big Ten Academic Alliance Geoportal.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Big Ten Academic Alliance Geospatial Data Project

gmd:name.gco:CharacterString: Big Ten Academic Alliance Geospatial Data Project
